sime

Class NetworkElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • sime.NetworkElement
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Endpoint, Link, Router

    public abstract class NetworkElement
extends java.lang.Object
    The interface for simulated network elements (nodes and links).
    Provides two universal methods: send(NetworkElement, Packet) for downcall and handle(NetworkElement, Packet) for upcall, from components that are above or below this component in the protocol stack.
    Author:
    Ivan Marsic

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double lastTimeProcessCalled
      Indicates when the last time the method process(int) was called, so that the Link knows how much time elapsed since the last call.
      (package private) java.lang.String name
      The given name of this network element, used mostly for reporting/debugging purposes.
      protected Simulator simulator
      Object that provides the runtime environment, mainly stuff related to the simulation clock, such as timer management and the reference time.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NetworkElement(Simulator simulator_, java.lang.String name_) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Attribute getter.
      Simulator getSimulator()
      Getter method.
      abstract void handle(NetworkElement source_, Packet packet_)
      The method to receive packets from a lower-layer protocol.
      abstract void process(int mode_)
      The method used by the simulator to signal the passage of time to this network element.
      abstract void send(NetworkElement source_, Packet packet_)
      The method to send data from an upper-layer protocol.
      Note that parameter source_ is usually ignored but Link.send(NetworkElement, Packet) uses it to distinguish the nodes connected to its ends.

        Indicates when the last time the method process(int) was called, so that the Link knows how much time elapsed since the last call.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Attribute getter.
        Returns:
        the name given to this network element
        See Also:
        name

      • getSimulator

        public Simulator getSimulator()
        Getter method.
        Returns:
        the simulator runtime environment

      • handle

        public abstract void handle(NetworkElement source_,
          Packet packet_)
        The method to receive packets from a lower-layer protocol.
        Parameters:
        source_ - the immediate source network element that passes this packet; which may not be the original source that generated this packet
        packet_ - a packet to receive from below and process

      • process

        public abstract void process(int mode_)
        The method used by the simulator to signal the passage of time to this network element. The element then needs to do the work appropriate for the amount of time elapsed since the previous call to this method (lastTimeProcessCalled).
        Parameters:
        mode_ - the processing mode, depends on the actual network element
        See Also:
        Simulator.run(java.nio.ByteBuffer, int)

      • send

        public abstract void send(NetworkElement source_,
        Packet packet_)
        The method to send data from an upper-layer protocol.
        Note that parameter source_ is usually ignored but Link.send(NetworkElement, Packet) uses it to distinguish the nodes connected to its ends.
        Parameters:
        source_ - the immediate source network element that sends this packet; note that this may not be the original source that generated this packet, but rather a router that simply relays someone else's packet
        packet_ - a packet from above to transmit
